column4: ive done this countless times, but for whatever reason, it isnt working on this machine
dont you think i tried that already
i use ssh tunneling and vnc to get into my linux machine
ok so when i vnc in, usually its set up as 127.0.0.1:port
i just get to a connection initialized
i know its on the linux end because i have no probelm on my other linux machines
ssh -X -L5900:localhost:5900 remote_machine_here --- then do vncviewer localhost
in the putty config, tell it to forward the local port 5900 to the remote port 5900. Then you can make your vnc client connect to localhost
ok, and connecting to port 50000 locally doesn't work?
are you sure the vnc server is started? try this: netstat -ltnp
it gives you the prompt again?
k, that means it's accepting connections :)
windows firewall getting in the way?
ill check, but i doubt it yesterday morning, on my old image i was fine, and then last night when i redid everything probelms!
i mean it knows that there is a connection, because anything else i type, no good, right away it will tell me i cant connect
